p: The hydrodistillation of the bark of C. verum gave a yellowish essential oil with 1% yield. Among the 15 components that were identified, the main component was trans-cinnamaldehyde (87.32%). The other considerable constituents were beta-tumerone (3.31%), O- cinnamaldehyde diethyl acetal (2.34%), and o-Methoxycinnamaldehyde (1.88%) ( Table 1). In this study, the oil consisted mainly of phenolic compounds (96.7%), sesquiterpene hydrocarbons (2.5%), and small amounts of monoterpene hydrocarbons (0.35%) ( Figure 1).
